Frequently.title: What are decentralized applications?
Frequently.desc: Decentralized applications are the decentralized alternatives to conventional applications. The unique highlight of dApps is that they run on peer-to-peer networks rather than using a single computer.

Frequently.title: What are the advantages of dApps over conventional apps?
Frequently.desc: Decentralized apps could provide better results than conventional apps by ensuring immutability of transaction records. In addition, dApps run autonomously without any centralized intervention as they depend on consensus mechanisms. Most important of all, dApps do not have a single point of failure.

Frequently.title: What is the cost of dApp development?
Frequently.desc: The cost of developing a decentralized application depends on the complexity of the app and number of features. In addition, you should also consider other factors such as the blockchain platform, consensus mechanism, security layers, API integrations and UI/UX requirements.

Frequently.title: What are the notable examples of dApps?
Frequently.desc: Some of the popular examples of dApps include decentralized exchanges, NFT marketplaces and DAOs or decentralized autonomous organisations. On top of it, you can also find industry-specific dApps such as insurance dApps or money management dApps.

Frequently.title: How can you choose a dApp development company?
Frequently.desc: You can select a dApp development company by checking the past projects of the company. You should also check the skillset of the dApp developers of the company and their expertise in working with different dApp development technologies.

Frequently.title: What is the average time for completing a dApp development project?
Frequently.desc: The average time for completing a dApp development project can vary from 4 to 12 months. However, the time required for developing dApps could differ according to complexity of the project and number of basic and sophisticated features required in the dApp.

Frequently.title: How can dApps interact with conventional systems and databases?
Frequently.desc: Decentralized apps could interact with conventional centralized systems and databases by using middleware or APIs. However, it would need additional development efforts and could introduce the element of centralization in the dApp. Therefore, it is important to review the trade-offs during integration with conventional systems.

TecnologisStack.title: Solidity
TecnologisStack.stack: We stand out for DeFi dApp development services with our expertise in using Solidity for writing smart code for different use cases. Solidity is the preferred smart contract programming language, which offers support for libraries, user-defined types and inheritance.

TecnologisStack.title: Golang
TecnologisStack.stack: Our expertise as a blockchain dApp development company is also visible in our capabilities for using Golang. We use Golang for creating smart contract codes in Hyperledger Fabric by utilising the open-source nature of the programming language.

TecnologisStack.title: Rust
TecnologisStack.stack: Rust is a statically typed, multi-paradigm language tailored for achieving higher performance. It focuses on performance and safety while supporting developers in creating resilient, stable and scalable dApps.

TecnologisStack.title: JavaScript
TecnologisStack.stack: We utilise JavaScript in DeFi dApp development for storing the code of decentralized apps. It is a prototype-based, dynamic language which offers support for declarative and object-oriented styles of programming.

TecnologisStack.title: Java
TecnologisStack.stack: Java is a trusted programming language for creating the backend code for microservices architecture required in certain dApps. We also utilise Java for writing SDKs for different blockchain platforms.

TecnologisStack.title: Node.js
TecnologisStack.stack: Node.js is a popular JavaScript library which supports dApp development projects. Our dApp development experts utilise Node.js for creating the backend for real-time decentralized applications involving multiple users.

Benefits.decs: Decentralized app development could serve as a competitive advantage to businesses by helping them prove their identity as a leader in embracing new technologies.
The working of dApps involves optimization of resource usage alongside accelerating the processing phase, thereby enabling seamless product exchange.
dApps ensure that all the changes are documented in immutable records, safeguarded by the consensus model and in-built cryptographic security.
Decentralized apps run on blockchain networks with multiple devices that ensure freedom from hardware failures and glitches in software.
Users donâ€™t have to depend on third parties or trust each other for transactions in dApps with the facility of blockchain explorers and audit trails.
Decentralized applications require limited management intervention and support as compared to traditional applications with management support from communities.
Decentralized applications do not have a single point of failure, which improves their fault tolerance and ensures immediate recognition of faults.
Smart contracts in dApps could help in automated execution of transactions without the involvement of central intermediaries or authorities.
Decentralized apps could also feature incentivization mechanisms for rewarding users for participation or ensuring positive behaviour.
Decentralized apps promote user governance by providing an equal stake to all participants in the decision-making process for the future of dApp.
Decentralized apps can guarantee better transparency with the facility of audit and data trails that also ensure internal accountability and regulatory compliance.
